refsect1.title: Summary
refsect1.para:
count
aggregates
count The count aggregate counts nonempty elements of an array's attributes. count(attr1), only counts the cells that have values that are NOT NULL. count(*), counts all of the cells present (both NULL and NOT NULL).

informalexample.para: This example finds the number of nonempty cells in a 3Ã—3 matrix.

step.para: Create a matrix m3x3:CREATE ARRAY m3x3<val:double>[i=0:2,3,0,j=0:2,3,0];

Put values 1 along the diagonal of m3x3 and leave the remaining cells empty:store(build_sparse(m3x3,1,i=j),m3x3);This query alters m3x3 to contain the following values:[ [(1),(),()], [(),(1),()], [(),(),(1)] ]
Find the number of nonempty cells in the array:aggregate(m3x3,count(val));This query returns:[(3)]
